member.name: T:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI
member.summary: Solids generation and handling, directly in the Revit API

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.GetWallSolid(Revit.Elements.Wall)
member.summary: Get Dynamo wall and return its solid geometry as Revit API solid
member.param: Wall || A wall instance from the host model
member.returns: Autodesk.DB.Solid || The solid, representing the wall Geometry in the API

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.GetWallSolidTransformed(Revit.Elements.Wall,Autodesk.Revit.DB.RevitLinkInstance)
member.summary: Get the Autodesk.DB.Solid for the specified wall from linked model
member.param: Wall || A wall instance from linked model
member.returns: Autodesk.DB.Solid || The solid, representing the wall Geometry in the API

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.GetAndUniteElementSolids(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Get all the solids of an Element, unite them and return the united solid with transformed coordinate system, based on the link instance. Works for all objects, classified as Dynamo Elements, such as Windows, Doors, etc.
member.returns: Autodesk.DB.Solid || A single solid, representing all element solids in the API

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.GetAndUniteElementSolidsTransformed(Revit.Elements.Element,Autodesk.Revit.DB.RevitLinkInstance)
member.summary: Get all the solids of an Element, unite them and return the united solid with transformed coordinate system, based on the link instance. Works for all objects, classified as Dynamo Elements, such as Windows, Doors, etc.
member.returns: Autodesk.DB.Solid || A single solid, representing all element solids in the API

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.ReturnDynamoSolid(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Solid)
member.summary: Wrap Revit Autodesk.Revit.DB.Solid to get Dynamo solid

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.RevitAPIExtrusionFromCurve(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create Autodesk.Revit.DB.Solid from a single curve, by offseting the curve in both direction, creating closed curveloop and extruding it
member.param: height || A specified width for the offset

member.name: M:GeometryAPI.SolidsAPI.RevitAPIExtrusionFromCurveTransformed(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,Autodesk.Revit.DB.RevitLinkInstance)
member.summary: Create Autodesk.Revit.DB.Solid from a single curve, by offseting the curve in both direction, creating closed curveloop, extruding and transforming its coordinate system
member.param: Double || A specified width for the offset

member.name: T:Inspect.ElementsData
member.summary: Retrieving and working with different elements' data

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.ReturnSystemTypeName(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Gets an element, belonging to a system family, e.g. Waals, Roofs, Floors, Ceilings. Works for both linked elements as well as elements in the host model
member.param: Revit.Elements.Element || Revit element, wrapped through Dynamo
member.returns: string || The type name of the element, eg. in the case of Walls, the name of the wall type

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.GetLinkedWallHostLevelName(Revit.Elements.Wall)
member.summary: Works for Walls, obtained from linked files. The node gets the end point of the wall location curve, gets its Z component and check if the given height corresponds to a level in the host model. It applies a tolerance of a 1 cm. If such level is found, its name will be returned as an output
member.param: Revit.Elements.Wall || Revit wall, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.GetLinkedWallHostElevation(Revit.Elements.Wall)
member.summary: Returns the host model elevation for the specified linked wall. The elevation is measured as the distance between the wall base curve's endpoint and the Project Base Point
member.param: Revit.Elements.Wall || Revit wall, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.EitherOneOfTwoParametersTypeInstance(Revit.Elements.Element,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This node would check if any of the specified parameters is available in the element, either as type or instance. It returns their value in the order they were specified - if a value is found for the first parameter, it will be returned. If not, it will proceed to the second one. If no value is found for both, it will return null
member.param: Revit.Elements.Element || Revit element, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.LevelElevation(Revit.Elements.Level)
member.summary: Returns the elevation for each specified level. Typically the distance to the Internal Origin
member.param: Revit.Elements.Level || Revit level, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.LinkedFamilyInstanceElevation(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Returns the elevation for each family instance, typically the distance to the Project Base Point. Works for families with origin, represented by a location point, such as Wall, Doors and other family instances. Note: The end result is rounded
member.param: Revit.Elements.Element || Revit element, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.LinkedDoorWindowHostLevelName(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Returns the name of the host model level for a Door or Window in a linked file. The level is calculated, based on the Family Instance location. Sill Height is subtracted from the elevation. The node uses a tolerance of 1 cm.
member.param: Revit.Elements.Element || Revit element, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.HostFamilyInstanceElevation(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Returns the elevation of a family instance from the host model. Works for elements with Location Point, such as Doors, Windows, etc. Returns the elevation as the distance to Project Base Point.
member.param: Revit.Elements.Element || Revit element, wrapped through Dynamo

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.IsElementInControlPhase(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Determines whether or not an element could be applied to the control phase. If an element was created in an earlier phase, than the one specified and was either not demolished or demolished in a later phase, the node returns True. Otherwise, it returns False
member.param: [string] || List with phase names, sorted in a chronological order
string || Name of the control phase
[Revit.Elements.Element] || list with Revit elements, wrapped through Dynamo

item.description: If any exceptions were found, they will be displayed here

member.search: phase, control phase, element, does belong to phase

member.name: M:Inspect.ElementsData.PhaseName(Revit.Elements.Element)
member.summary: Returns the name of the specified phase
member.param: Revit.Elements.Phase | Revit phase, wrapped through Dynamo
member.returns: string | The name of the phase as string

members.member:
